Medicinal plants were strongly threated in arid and semiarid ecosystems of the region. About 15% of medicinal plants lost more than 50% of their ecological importance in pastoral rangelands due to overexploitation. Locals are mostly poor people whom their livelihood strongly depends on natural resources in our study area
17 . Selling of medicinal plants has become an alternative and additive income source for pastorals, especially whom with forage deficiency resulted from recent droughts.
